title: SHR_4UDE Function Block
description:
GEN_SIN is a sine wave generator with programmable period, adjustable
amplitude and signal ofset. A special feature is a adjustable delay so that
with multiple generators overlapping signals can be generated. A Binary
Output Q passes a logical signal, which is generated phase equal to the
sine signal. The input DL is a delay for the output signal. The Delay is speï¿¾cifed with DL * PT. A DL of 0.5 delays the signal by half a period. 
The following example shows GEN_SIN with a trace recording of the sine
signal and the binary output Q.
The above example generates a sine wave with 0.1 Hz (PT = 10 s) and a
lower peak value of 0 and upper peak value of 10.
name: SHR_4UDE

input.name: SET
input.description: Control signal to set the output state.

input.name: D0
input.description: Input data bit to be shifted into the register at Q0.

input.name: D3
input.description: Input data bit to be shifted into the register at Q3.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock signal for controlling the shifting operation.

input.name: DN
input.description: Control signal for direct loading of data into the register.

input.name: RST
input.description: Control signal to reset the output state.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Output of the least significant bit of the shift register.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Output of the second bit of the shift register.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Output of the third bit of the shift register.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Output of the most significant bit of the shift register.
